text: The Party of Tatar National Independence İttifaq or Ittifak (, ) is a political party founded in the Tatar ASSR in April, 1990, and officially registered on January 3, 1992. Ittifaq was the first non-communist party in Tatarstan. It is commonly referred to as a Tatar nationalist party. It was named in honour of Ittifaq al-Muslimin, a pre-revolutionary Muslim political party represented in the parliament (Duma) of the czarist Russia. The aims, as claimed by the party, are: * revival of the Tatar nation * restoring Tatar statehood * recognition of the Tatar state as an international entity. The permanent leader of the Ittifaq party is Fauziya Bayramova. She has been leading the party for more than 20 years. The party published its own newspaper - Altın Urda - from 1993 to 1998. == References == ==See also== *All-Tatar Public Center *Secession in Russia Category:1990 establishments in Russia Category:1990 establishments in the Soviet Union Category:History of Tatarstan Category:Political parties established in 1990 Category:Political parties of minorities in Russia Category:Politics of Tatarstan Category:Separatism in Russia Category:Tatar nationalism Category:Tatar political parties
title: Ittifaq Party
